sen.j: 33面の三角縁神獣鏡が出土したことで有名。

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）から翌年にかけて奈良県立橿原考古学研究所が行った第3次発掘調査で、三角縁神獣鏡33面と画文帯神獣鏡1面が、副葬当時に近い状態で発見された。
sen.e: From 1997 to the next year the Kashihara Archaeological Institute, Nara prefecture conducted the third excavation research and discovered 33 sankakubuchishinju mirrors and one gamontaishinju mirror in almost the same state when they were buried.

From 1997 to the next year the Kashihara Archaeological Institute, Nara Prefecture conducted the third excavation research and discovered 33 Sankaku Shinju-kyo Mirrors and one Gamontai Shinju-kyo Mirror (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals) in almost the same state when they were buried.
sen.cmt: 統一リスト、用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: From 1997 to the next year the Kashihara Archaeological Institute, Nara Prefecture conducted the third excavation research and discovered 33 Sankaku Shinju-kyo Mirrors and one Gamontai Shinju-kyo Mirror (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals) in almost the same state when they were buried.

sen.j: 棺内には被葬者の頭のところに画文帯神獣鏡と両側に刀1・剣1をおき、棺外に東壁側15面、西壁側17面の三角縁神獣鏡を内側に向けて木棺と壁のわずかな間に立てられていた。
sen.e: In the coffin a gamontaishinju mirror was placed near the head of the deceased person and one katana (one-edged sword) and one tsurugi (two edged sword) on either side of it, and in the outside of the coffin fifteen sankakubuchishinju mirrors on the east wall and seventeen on the west wall, which faced inward, were placed in the small space between the coffin and the wall.

In the coffin the Gabuntai Shinju-kyo Mirror was placed near the head of the deceased person and one katana (one-edged sword) and one tsurugi (two-edged sword) on either side of it, and in the outside of the coffin 15 Sankaku Shinju-kyo Mirrors on the east wall and 17 on the west wall, which faced inward, were placed in the small space between the coffin and the wall.

sen.j: 後円部の埋葬施設は竪穴式石室で、内法長約8.3メートル、北小口幅0.9メートル、高さ約1.7メートルで、二上山麓の春日山と芝山の板石を持ち送りに積んで合掌造状の天井を作り出している。
sen.e: The burial facilities of the back circular part is a pit stone chamber with its inside measurement about 8.3m in length, north small entrance 0.9m in width and about 1.7m in height, and the ceiling was built in a gassho style and corbeled out with flagstones from Kasugayama and Shibayama at the foot of Mt.Nijozan.

The burial facilities of the back circular part is a pit stone chamber with its inside measurement approximately 8.3 meters in length, north small entrance 0.9 meters in width and about 1.7 meters in height, and the ceiling was built in a Gassho-zukuri style (an architect method with wooden beams combined to form a steep thatched roof that resembles two hands together) and corbelled out with flagstones from Mt. Kasuga and Mt. Shiba at the foot of Mt. Nijo.

sen.e: Moreover, this pit stone chamber points to almost true north, from which we can guess that the head of the deceased pointed to true north.
